modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God that overcomes human 'Incapacité' (Inability). Human confession is only possible through the Spirit's endowment.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Jesus as mere literary figure) to S2 (The shame/death of the cross) to S1 (The interceding, living Lord).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Right hand of God'—the objective reality of the Resurrection.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the 'ungodly' nature of the cross is emphasized as a scandal.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as 'ungodly' and 'unspiritual,' making God the sole initiator of salvation and the Spirit the sole enabler of faith.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential for works-righteousness in 'taking up the cross'

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He who did not spare his own Son but gave him up for us all
no one can say 'Jesus is Lord' except by the Holy Spirit

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly attacks exemplarism, calling the shift to 'Jesus the spiritual exemplar' an 'insidious development.'
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Peter (as a negative example of rebuking the cross)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Paul is not a hero of will, but one 'bearing the marks of Jesus' by the Spirit.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and ontological security in the face of suffering (suicide example).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the intellectual crisis of the Church to the personal crisis of the grieving parents is perfectly bridged by the actant of the 'Interceding Christ.'

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He died an ungodly death for ungodly people.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment: The Spirit gives the 'Pouvoir-dire' (Power to say) Lord.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical: Sin is seen as a power that causes shame and separation.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the primary Subject. It avoids the 'Helper-God' trap by making Christ the one who intercedes and the Spirit the one who enables confession.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a classic grace structure.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Opponent is already cosmic (Death, Powers, Satan).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in Rutledge's 'Grammar of Grace.' It refuses to let the hearer become the hero of their own faith.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'Jesus Seminar' polemic, Greimas shows that the polemic serves to protect the 'Subject' status of the Living Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 8; actantial analysis shows how Romans 8 functions as the 'engine' of hope for the suicidal son's parents.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'shame' is an Opponent that attempts to strip the Subject (Christ) of His 'Object' (the believer).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Heavy Opponent' (Death/Powers) to necessitate a 'Divine Subject,' effectively avoiding moralism.
